title: Milo Yiannopoulos book ‚ÄòDangerous‚Äô cancelled by publisher - National | Globalnews.ca
text:
February 20, 2017 5:48 pm Updated: February 20, 2017 5:58 pm Milo Yiannopoulos book ‚ÄòDangerous‚Äô cancelled by publisher By Hillel Italie The Associated Press 
WATCH ABOVE: Milo Yiannopoulos appearance turns to chaos at UC Berkeley What is this?

NEW YORK ‚Äî Milo Yiannopoulos ‚Äò publisher has cancelled his planned book, Dangerous . 
Simon & Schuster and its Threshold Editions imprint announced Monday that ‚Äúafter careful consideration‚Äù they had pulled the book, which had been high on Amazon.com‚Äôs best-seller lists and was the subject of intense controversy. Donald Trump threatens to revoke UC Berkeley‚Äôs federal funding after violent protest 
Dangerous was originally scheduled to come out in March. But had pushed back the release to June so he could write about the uprisings during his recent campus tour. 
More than 100 Simon & Schuster authors had objected to his book deal. Author Roxane Gay withdrew a planned book with the publisher. I am Milo's former manager. 
I have defended Milo for standing up for free speech on many occasions. 
Today, I cannot defend Milo anymore. 
‚Äî Bakedü•õAlaska‚Ñ¢ (@bakedalaska) February 20, 2017
